mainSubtitle: Learn to identify and protect yourself from common investment fraud schemes
rememberContent: If something sounds too good to be true, it probably is. Always do your own research (DYOR) and consult with licensed financial professionals before making investment decisions.
disclaimerContent: This information is for educational purposes only. It does not constitute financial advice. Always consult with qualified financial professionals before making investment decisions. Past performance does not guarantee future results.

guaranteed-returns.title: Guaranteed High Returns
guaranteed-returns.description: Be extremely wary of anyone promising guaranteed high returns. Legitimate investments always carry risk.
redFlags: Complex explanations that don't make sense
protectiveActions: Consult with a licensed financial advisor
Never invest more than you can afford to lose

urgency-pressure.title: Urgency and Pressure Tactics
urgency-pressure.description: Fraudsters often create artificial urgency to prevent you from doing proper research.
redFlags: Threats of missing out on opportunities
protectiveActions: Take your time to research thoroughly

unregistered-entities.title: Unregistered Investment Entities
unregistered-entities.description: Always verify that investment entities are properly registered with regulatory authorities.
redFlags: Not listed on official regulatory websites
Vague or evasive answers about registration
protectiveActions: Check SEBI website for mutual funds and PMS
Confirm AMFI registration for mutual funds

unsolicited-offers.title: Unsolicited Investment Offers
unsolicited-offers.description: Be cautious of investment opportunities that come to you unsolicited.
protectiveActions: Never invest based on unsolicited offers

complex-schemes.title: Overly Complex Investment Schemes
complex-schemes.description: Fraudsters often use complex schemes to confuse investors and hide the truth.
redFlags: Promises of tax benefits that seem too good
protectiveActions: If you don't understand it, don't invest

pyramid-schemes.title: Pyramid or Ponzi Schemes
pyramid-schemes.description: These schemes rely on recruiting new investors to pay existing ones.
redFlags: Focus on recruiting others to invest
Promises of commissions for bringing in new investors
No real product or service being sold
protectiveActions: Avoid any scheme focused on recruitment
Check if there's a real product or service
Be wary of 'network marketing' investment schemes
